Package services.descriptionreadability

Class DescriptionReadability

  • java.lang.Object
    • services.descriptionreadability.DescriptionReadability
  • public class DescriptionReadability
extends java.lang.Object
    DescriptionReadability class provides methods for computing flesch readbility indices, and auxiliary methods for counting sentences, words, syllables according to the rules specified in the following document: http://users.csc.calpoly.edu/~jdalbey/305/Projects/FleschReadabilityProject.html

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DescriptionReadability()
      Default empty constructor, not intended for use as such.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static double computeFleschKincaidGradeLevel​(java.lang.String text)
      Static method to compute Flesch Kincaid Grade Level
      Flesch Kincaid Grade Level = 0.39 * (Words / Sentences) + 11.8 * (Syllables / Words) * - 15.59
      static double computeFleschReadabilityIndex​(java.lang.String text)
      Static method to compute Flesch Readability Index
      Flesch Index = 206.835 - 84.6 * (Syllables / Words) - 1.015 * (Words / Sentences)
      static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> countSentences​(java.lang.String text)
      Static method to count the number of sentences in the given text
      Periods, exclamation points, question marks, colons and semicolons serve as sentence delimiters.
      static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> countSyllables​(java.lang.String text)
      Static method to count syllables in the given text
      static int countSyllablesInWord​(java.lang.String word)
      Static method to count syllables in the given word
      Syllables are counted according to following rules:
      Each vowel in a word is considered one syllable subject to:
      :: words of three letters or shorter count as single syllables;
      :: -es, -ed and -e (except -le) endings are ignored;
      :: consecutive vowels count as one syllable.
      static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> countWords​(java.lang.String text)
      Static method to count number of words in the given text
      Words are delimited by white space characters ( space, \n, \r, \t etc)
      static java.lang.String removePunctuation​(java.lang.String text)
      Static method to remove punctuation from the given text
      Non word characters (not in "[A-Za-z_]") are considered as puncutation

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DescriptionReadability

        public DescriptionReadability()
        Default empty constructor, not intended for use as such.
        Methods are deliberately static, as they are intended to be used with streams, as pure stateless functions

    • Method Detail

      • countSentences

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> countSentences​(java.lang.String text)
        Static method to count the number of sentences in the given text
        Periods, exclamation points, question marks, colons and semicolons serve as sentence delimiters.
        Parameters:
        text - Input string
        Returns:
        Integer wrapped in optional for number of sentences in the input text

      • removePunctuation

        public static java.lang.String removePunctuation​(java.lang.String text)
        Static method to remove punctuation from the given text
        Non word characters (not in "[A-Za-z_]") are considered as puncutation
        Parameters:
        text - Input string
        Returns:
        String with punctuation removed

      • countWords

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> countWords​(java.lang.String text)
        Static method to count number of words in the given text
        Words are delimited by white space characters ( space, \n, \r, \t etc)
        Parameters:
        text - Input string
        Returns:
        Integer wrapped in Optional for count of words

      • countSyllablesInWord

        public static int countSyllablesInWord​(java.lang.String word)
        Static method to count syllables in the given word
        Syllables are counted according to following rules:
        Each vowel in a word is considered one syllable subject to:
        :: words of three letters or shorter count as single syllables;
        :: -es, -ed and -e (except -le) endings are ignored;
        :: consecutive vowels count as one syllable.
        Parameters:
        word - Input string
        Returns:
        Integer wrapped in Optional for count of syllables

      • countSyllables

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> countSyllables​(java.lang.String text)
        Static method to count syllables in the given text
        Parameters:
        text - Input string
        Returns:
        Integer wrapped in Optional for count of syllables
        See Also:
        countSyllablesInWord(String)

      • computeFleschReadabilityIndex

        public static double computeFleschReadabilityIndex​(java.lang.String text)
        Static method to compute Flesch Readability Index
        Flesch Index = 206.835 - 84.6 * (Syllables / Words) - 1.015 * (Words / Sentences)
        Parameters:
        text - Input string
        Returns:
        Double value for flesh readability index
        See Also:
        computeFleschKincaidGradeLevel(String)

      • computeFleschKincaidGradeLevel

        public static double computeFleschKincaidGradeLevel​(java.lang.String text)
        Static method to compute Flesch Kincaid Grade Level
        Flesch Kincaid Grade Level = 0.39 * (Words / Sentences) + 11.8 * (Syllables / Words) * - 15.59
        Parameters:
        text - Input string
        Returns:
        Double value for flesch kincaid grade level
        See Also:
        computeFleschReadabilityIndex(String)
